thread.title: EastEnders Lee Carter actor Danny-Boy Hatchard speaks out about his departure from soap
thread.title_full: EastEnders Lee Carter actor Danny-Boy Hatchard speaks out about his departure from soap

author: Nicola Agius
title: EastEnders Lee Carter actor Danny-Boy Hatchard speaks out about his departure from soap
text:
Get soaps     
Eastenders fans said their final goodbyes to Lee Carter tonight. 
After arriving in Albert Square as the son of Mick and Linda, the former squaddie decided to pack his bags to start a new life in Dover tonight. 
His departure left wife Whitney in floods of tears. 
Before jumping into a black cab, his dad called out to him for one last heart-to-heart to say goodbye. Lee Carter (DANNY-BOY HATCHARD) (Photo: BBC) 
However, Mick - who encouraged him to leave in the first place - didn't attempt to talk him into staying. 
Instead, he wished him well and said the family would always be there for him should he ever need them. 
Actor Danny-Boy Hatchard, who plays Lee, described his final scenes as the "end of an era". 
Taking to Twitter, he wrote: "Duf duf duf duf duf duf duf #endofanera #EastEnders." 
Fortunately for fans, the door has been left open for the Walford favourite to return. Lee Carter (DANNY-BOY HATCHARD), Whitney Carter (SHONA MCGARTY) (Photo: BBC) 
Lee isn't the only member of the Carter family to be leaving town. 
Danny Dyer , who plays Mick, is said to be “exhausted” with his schedule and is taking some time out from the soap over the next few weeks - but there are fears he could now quit the soap. Mick Carter (DANNY DYER), Lee Carter (DANNY-BOY HATCHARD) (Photo: BBC) 
Three years ago, Danny was struck off work on doctor’s orders, after he vomited on set, and now producers are concerned he may be suffering again. 
Yesterday, a spokeswoman for the show said: “Danny is on a short break from EastEnders. This was not enforced by bosses nor has he quit the show.” 
EastEnders returns to BBC One on Monday at 8pm Like us on Facebook
